intro: Delissea truncata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of white and yellow. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly rough texture. Delissea truncata typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
